analysis.summary: NotificationItem.vue defines a reusable Vue component that displays a single notification entry with an icon, title, body text, relative timestamp, and an unread indicator. Clicking the entry emits a click event carrying the notification payload.
analysis.purpose: Provide a consistent UI block for rendering individual notifications in a notification list or dropdown, handling display logic (status, icon, time formatting) and user interaction.

components.name: NotificationItem
components.responsibilities: Accepts a notification object as a prop; computes unread state, icon and formatted date; renders the notification layout; emits a click event with the notification data

functions.name: isUnread
functions.description: Determines whether the passed notification has not been marked as read

functions.name: formattedDate
functions.description: Calculates a human-friendly relative time string (just now, minutes/hours/days ago or locale date) based on notification.createdAt

functions.name: notificationIcon
functions.description: Maps notification.type to a corresponding emoji icon (alert, success, error, info)

functions.name: handleClick
functions.description: Fires a click event to the parent with the full notification object

analysis.usage:
Imported and registered in a parent component (e.g. NotificationsList.vue) and used in template as:
<NotificationItem :notification="item" @click="onNotificationClick"/>
notes: Uses <script setup> syntax and scoped styles
Date formatting is done client-side without localization support beyond toLocaleDateString
